article_title: Idaho smokers lie about habit to avoid higher insurance rates
article_text:
The cheating results in pricier premiums for everyone else

Some fear crackdown would discourage people from enrolling

article_metadata.title: Idaho smokers lie about habit to avoid higher insurance rates | Idaho Statesman

og.description: Seventeen percent of Idaho adults smoke regularly, according to surveys, but fewer than 3 percent who buy coverage on the state’s health exchange pay the tobacco surcharge authorized by the Affordable Care Act. That means nonsmokers pay more than they should, Blue Cross of Idaho says.
